description.narrative: HRNS together with private actors within International Coffee Partners are strenghtening productivity as well as the capacity of coffee farmers organisations in order to improve livelihoods for small holder coffee farmers in Tanzania.

Insatsens övergripande mål om att bidra till att 25 000 bönder ska öka sina inkomster och därigenom minska fattigdom stämmer väl med målen i Resultatstrategin för Sveriges internationella utvecklingssamarbete med Tanzania 2013 – 2019. Insatsen för att stärka värdekedjan för kaffe i Tanzania syftar till att förbättra marknaden inom kaffejordbruket, skapa fungerande marknader och skapa/förbättra jobb. Resultatområde ett i resultatstrategin för samarbetet med Tanzania betonar dessa frågor, särskilt det förväntade resultatet: ”Utvecklade marknader i jordbruksproduktionen med ambitionen att fler fattiga människor, framför allt kvinnor, har fått arbete och ökade inkomster.”

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The program’s progress in outreach 2015 has been impressive with an increase of 8,052 households in 181 additional Producer Organizations (PO) as first-tier structure as well as 8 additional Depot Committees (DC) and 11 Rural Primary Cooperative Societies (RPCS) as second-tier structure. The increased interest of beneficiaries to join the HRNS program was due to the intensive sensitization of farmers in the project areas, the conservation agriculture component, as well as establishing effective linkages to service providers that were enhanced by the intensified organizational development trainings, which farmer organizations continuously receive from HRNS. The current beneficiaries are organized in 634 Producer Organisations as primary organizational structures (POs), 32 Depot Committees (DCs) and 39 Rural Primary Cooperative Societies (RPCS) both as secondary organizational structures, and the In addition, the 2014 established Apex organization Tanzanian Coffee Farmers Association (TCFA) in the North was supported financially and technically. Until December 2015 TCFA has bulked 230MT of parchment of which 224MT have already been delivered to the dry mill. Most of the TCFA coffee is home-processed and 27% is CPU coffee. Out of 127MT of green coffee marketed in 2015/2016 by TCFA until the end of 2015, 125MT have been sold at an average auction price of $ 2.39/kg green coffee. In the South, HRNS had re-organized the marketing via the DCs as second tier structure in the season 2014/15. Although marketing via the national auction was a new task for these farmers’ organizations, 241MT of parchment were collected and sold via the DCs with extensive assistance of HRNS. The prices were 37% higher than farm gate prices. The marketing season 2015/16 will end in March 2016 and in their second season; the DCs have already become stronger and better connected to their member POs. Until December 2015 already almost double the amount of parchment has been bulked by the DCs compared to the season 2014/15 (241MT in season 2014/15 compared to 480MT already bulked in the current season 2015/16). Also the quality of the bulked coffee could be maintained as well as an average curing loss of 19%. The detailed quantity and quality figures of the bulked coffee in season 2015/16 will be communicated in the next progress report. The beneficiaries could profit form the relatively high world market prices in season 2014/15. Since the coffee gross-margin of the beneficiaries depends highly on the world market prices for coffee, it is difficult to define a clear target for the project. However, the average gross margin of the beneficiaries shows the impact of coffee on the livelihood of the farming household. The coffee income contributes with about 40% to the overall household income. Therefore, the increase in coffee income contributes to improved access to education, health care, as well as food security and nutrition.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
